private_information: I am responsible for the left peg.
The left peg holds disks from top to bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F where A is smallest and F is largest.
left_agent.goal: Coordinate the relocation of the disks currently on the left peg so the final configuration is achieved.

private_information: I am responsible for the middle peg.
The middle peg is currently empty.
middle_agent.goal: Serve as an intermediary peg if needed following the rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one.

private_information: I am responsible for the right peg.
The right peg is currently empty.
right_agent.goal: Receive disks so that the final configuration places all disks on the right peg in correct order.

private_information: I coordinate the peg agents and produce the final PDDL description for planning.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and problem encoding the Tower of Hanoi instance for the Fast Downward planner that moves all disks from left to right following the rules.

init.disk_order: A is smallest, F is largest

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are six disks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F with A the smallest and F the largest.
Only one disk can be moved at a time.
A larger disk can never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in preparing inputs for the Fast Downward planner. Your job is to take the peg state descriptions from the peg agents and produce a complete and correct PDDL domain and PDDL problem encoding this Tower of Hanoi instance for the Fast Downward solver. You must model disk objects, peg objects, and a move action that respects the constraints: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller one. Keep action names and intended actor behavior explicit and unambiguous. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not emit anything outside those tags except minimal explanatory header if necessary.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You receive three state descriptions: {state_left}, {state_middle}, {state_right}. The public environment facts are: {environment->public_information}. Your private information is: {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Your global objective is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the peg states into a single PDDL domain and problem tailored for execution with Fast Downward. Ensure the domain includes types, predicates, and an action schema for moving a disk from one peg to another that enforces legality. Ensure the problem encodes the initial configuration exactly as provided and the goal configuration with all disks on the right peg in correct order. Enclose domain between <domain></domain> and problem between <problem></problem>.
